name: lymphoma
definition: A hematologic cancer that affects lymphocytes that reside in the lymphatic system and in blood-forming organs. [url:http\://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lymphoma, url:http\://www.lymphoma.org/site/pp.asp?c=bkLTKaOQLmK8E&b=6300161, url:http\://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/lymphoma.html]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, a CASP8-negative lymphoma cell line was resistant to the combination of gemcitabine, clofarabine and edelfosine, whereas other CASP-positive lymphoma lines displayed synergistic cytotoxicity (PMID: 24413065).

references.title: Synergistic cytotoxicity of gemcitabine, clofarabine and edelfosine in lymphoma cell lines.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, CASP-positive lymphoma cell lines displayed synergistic cytotoxicity to a combination of gemcitabine, clofarabine and edelfosine (PMID: 24413065).

references.title: Synergistic cytotoxicity of gemcitabine, clofarabine and edelfosine in lymphoma cell lines.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with EPZ005687 decreased proliferation and induced cell killing in a lymphoma cell line harboring EZH2 Y641F in culture (PMID: 23023262).

references.title: A selective inhibitor of EZH2 blocks H3K27 methylation and kills mutant lymphoma cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) inhibited proliferation and promoted cell death in lymphoma cell lines harboring EZH2 Y646F in culture, and decreased tumor H3K27Me3 levels in cell line xenograft models (PMID: 24563539).

references.title: Selective inhibition of EZH2 by EPZ-6438 leads to potent antitumor activity in EZH2-mutant non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of Glucophage (metformin) and Aldoxorubicin inhibited cell growth in human lymphoma cell lines in culture and inhibited tumor growth in xenograft models (PMID: 22378068).

references.title: Therapeutic metformin/AMPK activation blocked lymphoma cell growth via inhibition of mTOR pathway and induction of autophagy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I dose escalation study of birinapant, 50 patients with advanced solid tumors or lymphoma were enrolled and no patients achieved complete or partial remission (PMID: 26333381).

references.title: A Phase I Study of the SMAC-Mimetic Birinapant in Adults with Refractory Solid Tumors or Lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, over expression of MCL1 conferred resistance to ABT-737 in lymphoma cells in culture and mouse models (PMID: 17097561).

references.title: The BH3 mimetic ABT-737 targets selective Bcl-2 proteins and efficiently induces apoptosis via Bak/Bax if Mcl-1 is neutralized.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, ISIS-STAT3rx (AZD9150) treatment resulted in stable disease or partial response in 44% (11/25) of patients with lymphoma or advanced solid tumors (PMID: 26582900).

references.title: AZD9150, a next-generation antisense oligonucleotide inhibitor of STAT3 with early evidence of clinical activity in lymphoma and lung cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, lymphoma cells overexpressing constitutively active Akt demonstrated reduced sensitivity to Adriamycin (doxorubicin) treatment in cell line xenograft models (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, lymphoma cells overexpressing RHEB Q64L demonstrated reduced sensitivity to Adriamycin (doxorubicin) treatment in cell line xenograft models (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Rapamune (sirolimus) treatment did not improve survival in cell line xenograft animal models of lymphoma overexpressing constitutively active Akt (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Rapamune (sirolimus) treatment did not improve survival in cell line xenograft animal models of lymphoma over expressing RHEB Q64L (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Rapamune (sirolimus) and Adriamycin (doxorubicin) combination treatment resulted in improved survival and prolonged remission in cell line xenograft animal models of lymphoma overexpressing RHEB Q64L (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Rapamune (sirolimus) and Adriamycin (doxorubicin) combination treatment resulted in improved survival and prolonged remission in cell line xenograft animal models of lymphoma overexpressing constitutively active Akt (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment inhibited mTORC1 activation in lymphoma cell lines overexpressing RHEB Q64L (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment did not inhibit mTORC1 activation in lymphoma cell lines overexpressing RHEB Q64L and RHEB M184L (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment inhibited Rheb signaling and lead to cell death in lymphoma cell lines in culture, independent of the Myc amplification and Pten-deficiency (PMID: 18708578).

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment inhibited proliferation of lymphoma cell lines harboring MYC amplification, PTEN deficiency, and overexpressing RHEB Q64L in culture (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: MYC amp PTEN dec exp RHEB Q64L

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment did not inhibit proliferation of lymphoma cell lines harboring MYC amplification, PTEN deficiency, and overexpressing RHEB Q64L and RHEB M184L in culture (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: MYC amp PTEN dec exp RHEB Q64L RHEB M184L

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment did not inhibit proliferation of lymphoma cell lines harboring MYC amplification, PTEN deficiency, and overexpressing Mcl1 in culture (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: MCL1 over exp MYC amp PTEN dec exp

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment inhibited proliferation of lymphoma cell lines harboring MYC amplification, ARF deletion, and overexpressing RHEB Q64L and RHEB M184L in culture (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: ARF1 del MYC amp RHEB Q64L RHEB M184L

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Rapamune (sirolimus) and Adriamycin (doxorubicin) combination treatment inhibited survival of patient-derived lymphoma cells harboring TP53 inactivating mutation, MYC rearrangement, and RHEB overexpression (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: MYC rearrange RHEB over exp TP53 inact mut

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FTI-277 treatment inhibited survival of patient-derived lymphoma cells harboring TP53 inactivating mutation, MYC rearrangement, and RHEB overexpression (PMID: 18708578).

molecularProfile.profileName: MYC rearrange RHEB over exp TP53 inact mut

references.title: Tumorigenic activity and therapeutic inhibition of Rheb GTPase.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, Afinitor (everolimus) treatment resulted in an overall response rate of 44% (7/16) in T-cell lymphoma patients, with a median progression-free survival of 4.1 months and a median overall survival of 10.2 months (PMID: 25921059).

references.title: The mTORC1 inhibitor everolimus has antitumor activity in vitro and produces tumor responses in patients with relapsed T-cell lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, treatment with Aliqopa (copanlisib) in patients with indolent lymphoma resulted in an objective response rate of 59% (84/142), including a complete response in 12%, and demonstrated a median duration of response of 22.6 months and a median progression-free survival of 11.2 months (PMID: 28976790, PMID: 28633365; NCT01660451).

references.title: Phase II study of copanlisib, a PI3K inhibitor, in relapsed or refractory, indolent or aggressive lymphoma.
Phosphatidylinositol 3-Kinase Inhibition by Copanlisib in Relapsed or Refractory Indolent Lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, Aliqopa (copanlisib) treatment resulted in partial response in 20% (1/5) and stable disease in 40% (2/5) of patients with transformed lymphoma (PMID: 24852792).

references.title: Preliminary results of a phase II study of single agent Bay 80-6946, a Novel PI3K inhibitor, in patients with relapsed/refractory, indolent or aggressive lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ixazomib (MLN9708) inhibited survival and induced apoptosis in T-cell lymphoma cell lines in culture, and reduced tumor volume in xenograft models (PMID: 26988986).

references.title: Proteasomal Inhibition by Ixazomib Induces CHK1 and MYC-Dependent Cell Death in T-cell and Hodgkin Lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ixazomib (MLN9708) and JQ1 combination treatment resulted in increased apoptosis in T-cell lymphoma cells in culture (PMID: 26988986).

references.title: Proteasomal Inhibition by Ixazomib Induces CHK1 and MYC-Dependent Cell Death in T-cell and Hodgkin Lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Mekinist (trametinib) inhibited growth of human lymphoma cells harboring mutant NRAS in culture (PMID: 26343583).

references.title: Inhibition of RAF Isoforms and Active Dimers by LY3009120 Leads to Anti-tumor Activities in RAS or BRAF Mutant Cancers.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, knock-down of PRKAA1 with siRNA resulted in decreased response to Glucophage (metformin) induced growth inhibition in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 22378068).

references.title: Therapeutic metformin/AMPK activation blocked lymphoma cell growth via inhibition of mTOR pathway and induction of autophagy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, knock-down of PRKAA1 with siRNA reduced the additive effect of Glucophage (metformin) and Torisel (temsirolimus) combination treatment in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 22378068).

references.title: Therapeutic metformin/AMPK activation blocked lymphoma cell growth via inhibition of mTOR pathway and induction of autophagy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with JQ1 resulted in decreased expression of BCL2 and BCL2L1 in murine transgenic lymphoma cells over expressing MYC, subsequently leading to increased expression of BCL2L11 (Bim) and apoptotic activity in culture (PMID: 27406984).

molecularProfile.profileName: BCL2 pos BCL2L1 pos BCL2L11 pos MYC over exp

references.title: BET Inhibition Induces Apoptosis in Aggressive B-Cell Lymphoma via Epigenetic Regulation of BCL-2 Family Members.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, murine transgenic lymphoma cells over expressing MYC in culture demonstrated resistance to treatment with JQ1 due to a BCL2L11 (Bim)-null background (PMID: 27406984).

molecularProfile.profileName: BCL2 pos BCL2L1 pos BCL2L11 neg MYC over exp

references.title: BET Inhibition Induces Apoptosis in Aggressive B-Cell Lymphoma via Epigenetic Regulation of BCL-2 Family Members.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, a transgenic lymphoma mouse model, over expressing MYC and BCL2, treated with JQ1 resulted in a decreased response as indicated by reduced survival (PMID: 27406984).

molecularProfile.profileName: BCL2 over exp MYC over exp

references.title: BET Inhibition Induces Apoptosis in Aggressive B-Cell Lymphoma via Epigenetic Regulation of BCL-2 Family Members.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, transgenic murine MYC over expressing lymphoma cells harboring NRAS Q61K demonstrated over expression of BCL2, which resulted in resistance to treatment with JQ1 in culture (PMID: 27406984).

molecularProfile.profileName: BCL2 over exp MYC over exp NRAS Q61K

references.title: BET Inhibition Induces Apoptosis in Aggressive B-Cell Lymphoma via Epigenetic Regulation of BCL-2 Family Members.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, treatment with CPI-0610 in lymphoma patients resulted in decreased tumor volume in five patients and stable disease in six patients (Blood 2015 126:1491).

references.title: BET Inhibitor CPI-0610 Is Well Tolerated and Induces Responses in Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Follicular Lymphoma: Preliminary Analysis of an Ongoing Phase 1 Study

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Marizomib (NPI-0052) treatment resulted in complete response lasting more than 10 treatment cycles in 7.1% (1/14) of lymphoma patients (PMID: 27117181).

references.title: Phase I Clinical Trial of Marizomib (NPI-0052) in Patients with Advanced Malignancies Including Multiple Myeloma: Study NPI-0052-102 Final Results.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, S63845 inhibited survival of several lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 27760111).

references.title: The MCL1 inhibitor S63845 is tolerable and effective in diverse cancer models.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, S63845 inhibited survival of Myc-driven mouse lymphoma cells in culture and in syngeneic animal models (PMID: 27760111).

references.title: The MCL1 inhibitor S63845 is tolerable and effective in diverse cancer models.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, sensitivity to PU-H71 was correlated to presence of the epichaperome, a network of chaperome complexes, in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 27706135).

references.title: The epichaperome is an integrated chaperome network that facilitates tumour survival.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, a low dose of Rapamune (sirolimus) enhanced the efficacy of Ontak (denileukin diftitox) treatment in lymphoma mouse models, resulting in greater inhibition of tumor growth and higher survival compared to either agent alone (PMID: 27737881).

references.title: Biphasic Rapamycin Effects in Lymphoma and Carcinoma Treatment.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of VE-821 and JQ1 resulted in a synergistic effect, inhibiting cell growth of Myc-driven lymphoma mouse cells in culture (PMID: 26804177).

references.title: BET bromodomain inhibitors synergize with ATR inhibitors to induce DNA damage, apoptosis, senescence-associated secretory pathway and ER stress in Myc-induced lymphoma cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of VE-821 and RVX2135 resulted in decreased cell viability and increased levels of PARP cleavage in Myc-driven lymphoma mouse cells in culture (PMID: 26804177).

references.title: BET bromodomain inhibitors synergize with ATR inhibitors to induce DNA damage, apoptosis, senescence-associated secretory pathway and ER stress in Myc-induced lymphoma cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of RVX2135 and AZ20 resulted in reduced levels of lymphoma cells and improved survival of Myc-driven lymphoma mouse models (PMID: 26804177).

references.title: BET bromodomain inhibitors synergize with ATR inhibitors to induce DNA damage, apoptosis, senescence-associated secretory pathway and ER stress in Myc-induced lymphoma cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, patients with T-cell lymphoma demonstrated an overall response rate of 40% (6/15) and a median duration response of 11.5 months when treated with Abexinostat (PCI-24781) (PMID: 28126962).

references.title: Safety and efficacy of abexinostat, a pan-histone deacetylase inhibitor, in non-Hodgkin lymphoma and chronic lymphocytic leukemia: results of a phase II study.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, lymphoma cells over expressing BTK C481T were resistant to Imbruvica (ibrutinib) in culture (PMID: 27282255).

references.title: Substitution scanning identifies a novel, catalytically active ibrutinib-resistant BTK cysteine 481 to threonine (C481T) variant.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, MYC-driven mouse lymphoma cells were resistant to induction of apoptosis by LCL161 in culture, and LCL161 accelerated disease progression and increased susceptibility to septic shock in MYC-driven lymphoma mouse models (PMID: 27043662).

references.title: The SMAC mimetic, LCL-161, reduces survival in aggressive MYC-driven lymphoma while promoting susceptibility to endotoxic shock.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, ACP-319 treatment blocked cell proliferation in multiple lymphoma cell lines in culture (Eur J of Cancer, Dec 2016, 69;1, S39-S40).

references.title: The novel BTK and PI3K-delta inhibitors acalabrutinib (ACP-196) and ACP-319 show activity in pre-clinical B-cell lymphoma models

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, treatment with ALRN-6924 in patients with advanced solid tumors and lymphomas resulted in a disease control rate of 45% (25/55), with 2 patients experiencing a complete response, 2 patients achieving a partial response, and 21 patients demonstrating stable disease (J Clin Oncol 35, 2017 (suppl; abstr 2505)).

references.title: Phase I trial of a novel stapled peptide ALRN-6924 disrupting MDMX- and MDM2-mediated inhibition of WT p53 in patients with solid tumors and lymphomas

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, UCART19 cells demonstrated anti-tumor activity in xenograft models of CD19-positive lymphoma (J Clin Oncol 33, 2015 (suppl; abstr 3069)).

references.title: UCART19, an allogeneic “off-the-shelf” adoptive T-cell immunotherapy against CD19+ B-cell leukemias.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, seven patients with lymphoma treated with a combination of Veliparib (ABT-888) and Bendamustine demonstrated an overall response rate of 71% (5/7) and complete response rate of 57% (4/7) and progression free survival of 6.9 months (PMID: 28314788; NCT01326702).

references.title: The PARP Inhibitor Veliparib Can Be Safely Added to Bendamustine and Rituximab and Has Preliminary Evidence of Activity in B-Cell Lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, EDO-S101 and Kyprolis (carfilzomib) worked synergistically to decrease viability of a lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 28753594).

references.title: The first-in-class alkylating HDAC inhibitor EDO-S101 is highly synergistic with proteasome inhibition against multiple myeloma through activation of multiple pathways.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, EDO-S101 and Velcade (bortezomib) worked synergistically to decrease viability of lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 28753594).

references.title: The first-in-class alkylating HDAC inhibitor EDO-S101 is highly synergistic with proteasome inhibition against multiple myeloma through activation of multiple pathways.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, GNE-272 treatment resulted in anti-proliferative activity in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 27682507).

references.title: Discovery of a Potent and Selective in Vivo Probe (GNE-272) for the Bromodomains of CBP/EP300.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, CEP-28122 did not inhibit growth of ALK-negative lymphoma cells in culture (PMID: 22203728).

references.title: CEP-28122, a highly potent and selective orally active inhibitor of anaplastic lymphoma kinase with antitumor activity in experimental models of human cancers.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, PQR309 inhibited proliferation of lymphoma cells in culture, which was found to be due to the induction cell cycle arrest (PMID: 29066507).

references.title: PQR309 Is a Novel Dual PI3K/mTOR Inhibitor with Preclinical Antitumor Activity in Lymphomas as a Single Agent and in Combination Therapy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination therapy of PQR309 and Venclexta (venetoclax) led to antitumor activity in lymphoma cells in culture and cell line xenograft models, demonstrating both synergistic and additive effects (PMID: 29066507).

references.title: PQR309 Is a Novel Dual PI3K/mTOR Inhibitor with Preclinical Antitumor Activity in Lymphomas as a Single Agent and in Combination Therapy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination therapy of Farydak (panobinostat) and PQR309 induced apoptosis and led to synergistic and additive effects in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 29066507).

references.title: PQR309 Is a Novel Dual PI3K/mTOR Inhibitor with Preclinical Antitumor Activity in Lymphomas as a Single Agent and in Combination Therapy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination therapy of PQR309 and Rituxan (rituximab) led to a synergistic effect in 2/5 lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 29066507).

references.title: PQR309 Is a Novel Dual PI3K/mTOR Inhibitor with Preclinical Antitumor Activity in Lymphomas as a Single Agent and in Combination Therapy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, APTO-253 treatment in acute myeloid leukemia cell lines resulted in decreased proliferation in culture (PMID: 29626127).

references.title: APTO-253 Stabilizes G-quadruplex DNA, Inhibits MYC Expression, and Induces DNA Damage in Acute Myeloid Leukemia Cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, ADCT-602 (hLL2-cys-PBD) demonstrated cytotoxicity in several CD22-expressing lymphoma cell lines in culture, and induced tumor regression in CD22-expressing lymphoma xenograft models (Blood 2016 128:4176).

references.title: hLL2-Cys-PBD, a New Site-Specifically Conjugated, Pyrrolobenzodiazepine (PBD) Dimer-Based Antibody Drug Conjugate (ADC) Targeting CD22-Expressing B-Cell Malignancies.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, a mouse surrogate of CDX-527 enhanced T cell-mediated vaccine response in CD27 transgenic mice, resulted in anti-tumor activity in a syngeneic lymphoma model (AACR Annual Meeting 2019, Abstract 2392).

references.title: CDX-527: A novel bispecific immune-modulating antibody targeting CD27 and PD-L1

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with SB 11285 delayed and inhibited tumor growth in a syngeneic mouse model of lymphoma ournal of Clinical Oncology 2017 35:15_suppl, e14616).

references.title: Preclinical studies of SB 11285, a novel STING agonist for immuno-oncology.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide) and SB 11285 combination treatment delayed and inhibited tumor growth in a syngeneic mouse model of lymphoma (Journal of Clinical Oncology 2017 35:15_suppl, e14616).

references.title: Preclinical studies of SB 11285, a novel STING agonist for immuno-oncology.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, lymphoma cells expressing BTK T316A were resistant to Imbruvica (ibrutinib) in culture (PMID: 27626698)

references.title: Identification of a structurally novel BTK mutation that drives ibrutinib resistance in CLL.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, lymphoma cells expressing BTK C481S were resistant to Imbruvica (ibrutinib) in culture (PMID: 27626698)

references.title: Identification of a structurally novel BTK mutation that drives ibrutinib resistance in CLL.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) inhibited proliferation and induced apoptosis in lymphoma cell lines harboring EZH2 Y646N in culture, and complete eradication of tumors in cell line xenograft models (PMID: 24563539).

references.title: Selective inhibition of EZH2 by EPZ-6438 leads to potent antitumor activity in EZH2-mutant non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) inhibited proliferation and induced apoptosis in lymphoma cell lines harboring EZH2 A682G in culture, and complete tumor regression in cell line xenograft models (PMID: 24563539).

references.title: Selective inhibition of EZH2 by EPZ-6438 leads to potent antitumor activity in EZH2-mutant non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, FT516 in combination with Rituxan (rituximab) enhanced ADCC and cytokine production, resulted in reduced tumor burden in cell line xenograft models of disseminated lymphoma (Cancer Res 2019;79(13 Suppl):Abstract nr 3191).

references.title: FT516, an off-the-shelf engineered NK cell therapeutic product for universal anti-tumor targeting strategy in combination with monoclonal antibodies

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, MYCi975 treatment inhibited viability of a Myc-positive lymphoma cell line in culture (PMID: 31679823).

references.title: Small-Molecule MYC Inhibitors Suppress Tumor Growth and Enhance Immunotherapy.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, GSK3368715 inhibited growth of lymphoma cell lines in culture, and demonstrated cytotoxicity in 56% of cell lines tested (PMID: 31257072).

references.title: Anti-tumor Activity of the Type I PRMT Inhibitor, GSK3368715, Synergizes with PRMT5 Inhibition through MTAP Loss.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, MTAP deficiency was associated with sensitivity to GSK3368715 in lymphoma cell lines in culture (PMID: 31257072).

references.title: Anti-tumor Activity of the Type I PRMT Inhibitor, GSK3368715, Synergizes with PRMT5 Inhibition through MTAP Loss.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, ARQ 531 treatment increased survival in a transgenic mouse model of aggressive lymphoma with a median of 47 days vs. 38 days compared to Imbruvica (ibrutinib) (p=0.036) (PMID: 30093506).

references.title: The BTK Inhibitor ARQ 531 Targets Ibrutinib-Resistant CLL and Richter Transformation.
